perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor shall obtain at its own cost and expense and maintain the insurance in full force and effect during the term of the Agreement as required herein. A copy of the (i) certificate(s) of insurance and (ii) endorsements, acceptable to EDGE, shall be submitted to EDGE prior to commencement of any Work and renewals or replacements of such certificates shall be so delivered at least 30 days prior to the expiration or termination of each such policy. A copy of the insurance policies shall promptly be made available to EDGE upon EDGE' request. Subcontractor expressly acknowledges while EDGE retains the right to review the insurance provided by Subcontractor and' Lower-tier Subcontractors, EDGE is not obligated to perform such review. In addition, EDGE exercise of such right is for EDGE' benefit alone and shall confer no rights to Subcontractor or to any third party. EDGE's acceptance of or failure to object to the submitted documents does not constitute approval of coverage that is not in compliance with this Agreement or as acceptance or affirmation of the adequacy or applicability of such insurance.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor shall obtain at its own cost and expense and maintain the insurance as it deems necessary during the term of the Agreement. Subcontractor may provide a certificate(s) of insurance and endorsements. A copy of the insurance policies will be available upon request, depending on availability. Subcontractor acknowledges EDGE may review the insurance provided and EDGE is not obligated to perform such review. In addition, EDGE exercise of such right is for EDGE' benefit alone and shall confer no rights to Subcontractor or to any third party. EDGE's acceptance of or failure to object to the submitted documents does not constitute approval of coverage that is not in compliance with this Agreement or as acceptance or affirmation of the adequacy or applicability of such insurance.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces ambiguity regarding the type and amount of insurance required, replacing 'as required herein' with 'as it deems necessary.' Also, the modification makes the submission of the insurance certificate optional by using 'may' instead of 'shall,' and the term 'depending on availability' creates ambiguity around insurance availability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code - ยง 81.051. DUTY TO ENSURE FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
perturbation.law_explanation: Texas Insurance Code ยง 81.051 mandates that individuals and entities maintain financial responsibility, often through insurance, to cover potential liabilities. The modification gives the subcontractor too much discretion in determining necessary insurance, which might not be adequate to cover potential liabilities arising from the work, thus contradicting the spirit and intent of the law that ensures sufficient financial backing for potential damages or claims. Specifically, by making the subcontractor's assessment of 'necessary' insurance subjective, it fails to guarantee that the minimum coverage levels required by law or standard industry practices are met.

perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor shall comply with all applicable laws (including, without limitation the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Act, Hazardous Communication Requirements, and all applicable environmental protection laws, rules, regulations and ordinances), ordinances, rules, regulations and lawful orders of any public authority having jurisdiction for the safety of persons or property or to protect them from damage, injury or loss.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor shall endeavor to comply with applicable laws (including, without limitation the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Act, Hazardous Communication Requirements, and all applicable environmental protection laws, rules, regulations and ordinances), ordinances, rules, regulations and lawful orders of any public authority having jurisdiction for the safety of persons or property or to protect them from damage, injury or loss.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall comply' to 'shall endeavor to comply' weakens the obligation to comply with safety laws. 'Endeavor' implies an attempt, but not a guarantee, of compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970, Section 5(a)(1)
perturbation.law_explanation: The Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970, Section 5(a)(1), requires employers to furnish to each of his employees employment and a place of employment which are free from recognized hazards that are causing or are likely to cause death or serious physical harm to his employees. By changing 'shall comply' to 'shall endeavor to comply', it creates a lower standard than required by the OSHA act, meaning the subcontractor may not have to maintain a workplace free of hazards which goes against the OSHA act.
perturbation.location: Section 18. PROTECTION OF PERSONS AND PROPERTY

perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor will pay for all services, equipment, material and labor used under this Agreement and will keep EDGE' and Customer's property and work sites free of all claims or liens.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor will attempt to pay for all services, equipment, material and labor used under this Agreement and will try to keep EDGE' and Customer's property and work sites free of all claims or liens.
perturbation.explanation: The altered text changes 'will pay' to 'will attempt to pay' and 'will keep' to 'will try to keep'. 'Attempt' and 'try' are subjective and do not guarantee that all services, equipment, material and labor are paid for. Also, they do not guarantee that the property and work sites are free of all claims or liens.
perturbation.law_citation: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 28
perturbation.law_explanation: The Texas Prompt Payment Act sets requirements for making timely payments to contractors and subcontractors. The change from 'will pay' to 'will attempt to pay' introduces ambiguity that conflicts with the Texas Prompt Payment Act, which requires payments to be made according to a fixed schedule. The original text ensures that payment is made for all services while the modified version indicates that payment may or may not be made.
